subtitle: This stuffed lamb recipe is good for entertaining as there's not much to do once prepared.

method.text: Open out the lamb, skin side down on the surface. Season well.
Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the onion for 2-3 min or until just soft. Take off the heat and stir in remaining ingredients to make the stuffing.

Stuff the lamb with the mixture. Sew up the opening with a string. Form into a round ball. Secure with the string and weigh the joint to calculate the cooking time. Allow 25 min per 450 g weight plus 25 min over.
Place the lamb in a roasting tin. Season. Cook for calculated time, basting occasionally with the meat juice.
Remove  joint from oven. Leave to stand for 10-15 min before carving.

title: Ballantine of lamb
